item.title: 06. Sunny
item.description: Elizabeth met Sunny in Stanford's Mandarin program. She was 18, he was 19 years older and married. Elizabeth had struggled and gotten bullied and Sunny helped her out. Sunny was arrogant and demeaning to employees. Sunny was a sucker for #hours clocked in. 8 hours a day showed a lack of dedication. But Elizabeth had utmost confidence in him. That Sunny (COO) and Elizabeth (CEO) were dating wasn't disclosed to the board.

item.title: Third Base [Scott Galloway]
item.description: Third Base. Scott Galloway. No Mercy, No Malice. https://www.profgalloway.com/third-base/. 2019-12-13. I don’t know much about physics but constantly reference Galileo despite knowing little besides the fact that he dared challenge the church. :-) Dunning–Kruger Effect: a cognitive bias in which people assess their cognitive ability as greater than it is. (en.wikipedia.org) Masayoshi Son turned $20m into Alibaba into $100b. But he's mistaking luck in VC for his superior intuition.

item.title: You Probably Won't Make it to the Top [DHH]
item.description: You Probably Won't Make it to the Top. David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH). Signal vs. Noise. https://m.signalvnoise.com/youre-probably-won-t-make-it-to-the-top-8d2146abb790. 22nd Nov, 2018. Fallacy: If you really set your mind to it, you can do it… That’s how I did it. I just wanted it more, worked hard, and eventually all my dreams came true. I won’t say it’s easy, but it’s up to you! Odds are overwhelmingly that you will not make it to the top.

item.title: The Psychology of Money [Morgan Housel]
item.description: The Psychology of Money. Morgan Housel. The Collaborative Fund. http://www.collaborativefund.com/blog/the-psychology-of-money/. 2018-06-01. Luck and risk are different sides of the same coin. People underestimate the role of luck and risk. There are a billion investors. By sheer chance, we expect a couple of them to be billionaires predominantly off luck. But it's hard to point fingers after the fact. Some people are born into families that encourage education; others are against it.
